data.title: DRC Publishing
data.text:
Description

A true and powerful story shocking and heartbreaking in its naked honesty.

Author Clarissa Smith grew up along the Labrador/Quebec border in the 1950s and 1960s. Broken Wings is a story about love, hate and

abandonment. Clarissa’s mother died when she was 14 and she was left to care for her younger siblings. Alone, with their father gone, the family

almost starved to death. The book is Clarissa’s telling of a promise to her dying mother that she couldn’t keep. Clarissa’s story is one you won’t be

able to put down and one that you will never ever forget.
